newsitem.title: UK: Moody's assigns Aa2 rating to Danske Kredit bonds.
newsitem.headline: Moody's assigns Aa2 rating to Danske Kredit bonds.

text.p: Moody's Investors Service said on Friday it had assigned an Aa2 rating to the mortgage bonds issued by Danske Kredit.
Danske Kredit is a mortgage credit institution 100 percent-owned by Den Danske Bank (rated Aa3/P1/B).

Moody's said it viewed the credit characteristics of Danske Kredit's mortgage bonds to be directly linked to the creditworthiness of this institution itself, and consequently to that of its parent bank, Den Danske Bank

Moody's added that the Aa2 rating of Danske Kredit's secured mortgage bonds -- when compared to Den Danske Bank's Aa3 long-term debt and deposit ratings -- was boosted by their comparatively lower probability of default and especially by the smaller anticipated loss severity should a default occur.
